CatDescriptText: Wayne Prentice, high school student, West Mifflin and Charles Whitney, McKeesport were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 4, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is immediate danger of a third world war? Why? If so, whom do you think our allies will be?  Mr. Prentice's answer reads: "I can't say, but I hope we are not in any danger.  I hope that they come to some kind of an agreement."  Mr. Whitney's answer reads: "No, because if war started, it would mean the end of the world.  The Russians know it the same as we do."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Wayne Prentice wearing striped necktie and eyeglasses, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Charles Whitney wearing dark polo shirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Bud Saunder's Flowers store window on left, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
